name: Sts. Cyril and Methodius

locations.description: Apostles to the Slavs, missionaries to Moravia

summary: Cyril and Methodius were Byzantine Greek brothers who became missionaries to the Slavs. They are credited with creating the Glagolitic alphabet, the first alphabet used to transcribe Old Church Slavonic. They translated the Bible and liturgical texts into Slavonic, which helped spread Christianity among Slavic peoples. They are venerated as the Apostles to the Slavs and are co-patrons of Europe. Their work laid the foundation for the Cyrillic alphabet used today in many Slavic countries.
